title: How does a water heater heat water and air? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are different types of water heaters, the way the water is heated depends on the type of water heater, some of the most common type of water heaters are either Tankless or Storage water heaters. Both storage and tankless water heaters exist in electrical and gas versions. Water heaters are not intended to heat the air, the air around the water heater can heat as a by-product of heating the water but it’s not it’s main purpose, water heaters are well insulated to keep most heat inside the unit where is needed most. If you like to learn more about how water heaters work you should read the posts we wrote on this topic:  Tankless Water Heaters vs. Storage Water Heaters Gas vs. Electric Tankless Water Heaters - Team Enoch
